posts.post_content:
I found a good home for this guy in my [Animar, Soul of Elements](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animar, Soul of Elements) EDH deck. It's all based around playing cheap/free creatures and drawing to find more. Enablers: [Primordial Sage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primordial Sage), [Soul of the Harvest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul of the Harvest), [Kavu Lair](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kavu Lair), [Recycle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Recycle), [Glimpse of Nature](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimpse of Nature), [Wirewood Savage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wirewood Savage), [Garruk's Packleader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk's Packleader), [Vedalken Archmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vedalken Archmage), [Fathom Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fathom Mage) or [Cloudstone Curio](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudstone Curio). Of course, so do the other 9 artifact beasts.  
  
Plus, in edh it's great to have a 4 power body in front of you to keep you from being a target and the 2 life only helps you play table politics.  
  
You don't need to do anything silly like donate for this guy to shine, his errata to beast makes him an all-star for me.

Of course, so do the other 9 artifact beasts.

Plus, in edh it's great to have a 4 power body in front of you to keep you from being a target and the 2 life only helps you play table politics.

You don't need to do anything silly like donate for this guy to shine, his errata to beast makes him an all-star for me.
